metadata.Title: CVE-2022-2526 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A use-after-free vulnerability was found in systemd. This issue occurs due to the on_stream_io() function and dns_stream_complete() function in 'resolved-dns-stream.c' not incrementing the reference counting for the DnsStream object. Therefore, other functions and callbacks called can dereference the DNSStream object, causing the use-after-free when the reference is still used later.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-2526` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss-myhostname - 249.11-0ubuntu3.4
libnss-mymachines - 249.11-0ubuntu3.4
libnss-resolve - 249.11-0ubuntu3.4
libnss-systemd - 249.11-0ubuntu3.4
libpam-systemd - 249.11-0ubuntu3.4
libsystemd0 - 249.11-0ubuntu3.4
libudev1 - 249.11-0ubuntu3.4
systemd - 249.11-0ubuntu3.4
systemd-container - 249.11-0ubuntu3.4
systemd-coredump - 249.11-0ubuntu3.4
systemd-journal-remote - 249.11-0ubuntu3.4
systemd-oomd - 249.11-0ubuntu3.4
systemd-standalone-sysusers - 249.11-0ubuntu3.4
systemd-standalone-tmpfiles - 249.11-0ubuntu3.4
systemd-sysv - 249.11-0ubuntu3.4
systemd-tests - 249.11-0ubuntu3.4
systemd-timesyncd - 249.11-0ubuntu3.4
udev - 249.11-0ubuntu3.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: systemd package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '249.11-0ubuntu3.4').
